Batch update to change subject links.

did.abstract: The Moore mss., 1916-1922, consist of letters from Richard Aldington, 1892-1962, author, and Wyndham Lewis, 1882-1957, author, to Thomas Sturge Moore, 1870-1944, poet and wood engraver.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Aldington, 1892-1962, was an English writer best known for his World War I poetry.
Wyndham Lewis, 1882-1957, was a painter, author, and critic who co-founded the Vorticist movement in art and literature.
Thomas Sturge Moore, 1870-1944, was a poet and wood engraver.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Moore mss., 1916-1922, consist of letters from Richard Aldington, 1892-1962, and Wyndham Lewis, 1882-1957,to Thomas Sturge Moore, 1870-1944.

The Aldington letters, 1919-1922, relate to Aldington's writing, Moore's writing, the periodical Coterie, nineteenth century English poets, Thomas Stearns Eliot, and the need for "a lively literary quarterly."
The Lewis letters, 1916-1918, are concerned with Lewis' writing, Moore's writing, and Lewis' enlisting in the army.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Moore mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
